intro: Roucheria columbiana, commonly known as the Columbia rush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Juncaceae family and is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and tall, slender flowering stems. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and in wet meadows. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing a distinctive, feathery appearance. Roucheria columbiana is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
